TestCase.Title: Test case EID_CLIENT_C3_08
TestCase.Purpose: Positive test that checks the ability of the eID-Client to built a suitable certificate chain for Terminal Authentication if the ICC contains a new trust point and the eID-Server sends no additional link certificates in EAC1InputType..
TestCase.Precondition: A single basic card reader is connected to the eID-Client system.
A single active eID-Card is connected to the card reader.
The eID-Card has the following trust point(s): [CERT_CV_CVCA_4_s] from [CERT_SET_4].
If the eID-Client has a Trust store, the Trust store of the eID-Client is configured as stated in the ICS and b=s.
The eID-Client has been activated and the communication channels TLS-1, TLS-1-2 and TLS-2 have been established.
The eService uses the TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_4_A] from [CERT_SET_4].
The eID-Server uses the TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_EIDSERVER_4_A] from [CERT_SET_4].
The eService has sent a default TC Token to the eID-Client.
The eID-Client and the eID-Server have established PAOS communication.

TestStep.Description: The message "DIDAuthenticate_EAC1InputType" contains the parameters "Certificate" and "CertificateDescription".
The certificate chain from [CERT_SET_4] is sent in given order: [CERT_CV_TERM_4_A], [CERT_CV_DV_4_A].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client displays EAC data received from the eID-Server before the user enters his PIN.

TestStep.Description: The message "DIDAuthenticate_EAC1InputType" contains the parameters "Certificate" and "CertificateDescription".
The certificate chain from [CERT_SET_4] is sent in given order: [CERT_CV_TERM_4_A], [CERT_CV_DV_4_A].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client displays EAC data received from the eID-Server before the user enters his PIN.

Command.Text: Do not change CertificateHolderAuthorizationTemplate and enter the correct PIN of the eID-Card.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client starts Terminal Authentication. If the eID-Clients sends certificate chain during the step to the eID-Card, it MUST be of the following form: [CERT_CV_DV_4_A], [CERT_CV_TERM_4_A].

Command.Text: CONDITIONAL: If the certificate chain was not sent by the eID-Client to the eID-Card during the last step, the eID-Server invokes DIDAuthenticate_EAC2InputType

TestStep.Description: The message "DIDAuthenticate_EAC2InputType" contains the parameters "EphemeralPublicKey" and "Signature".
The element "EphemeralPublicKey" contains the generated public key for Chip Authentication.
The element "Signature" contains the calculated signature for Terminal Authentication.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client performs Terminal Authentication and sends the following certificate chain to the eID-Card: [CERT_CV_DV_4_A], [CERT_CV_TERM_4_A].
